_comment: Created by NCODowd on 24/05/2016 16:31:55 using v2.7
title: How has the proportion of respondents not able to contact their care coordinator changed?
analysis_commentary: Until 2013, NHS mental health service users were asked whether they could contact their care coordinator and 96% agreed they could. In 2014 the question was changed to ask if the user knew how to contact their care coordinator if they had a concern about their care. In 2014 only 3.1% of people said they didn't know how to contact their care coordinator and this increased to 3.6% in 2015.
data_source: Care Quality Commission, Community Mental Health Survey
